title.narrative: Awareness, importance, and meaning (AIM): HIV cure experiences and perspectives of PLHIV and key populations

description.narrative: If we want to increase social engagement of PLHIV and KP with HIV cure and HIV cure research, then it is critical to assess awareness, importance and meaning of an HIV cure, preferences for specific HIV cure strategies, information needs and communication impact on informed decisions. This will ensure the game changing quest of an HIV cure is aligned with the needs and lives of PLHIV and KP. As (the prospect of) an HIV cure is gaining more prominence, now is the time to ensure PLHIV and KP are engaged and their perspectives take centre stage in HIV cure research.

The HIV community is galvanizing around the quest for an HIV cure, which will have significant implications for PLHIV. It is imperative that PLHIV and KP are involved in an early stage and in all facets of HIV cure agenda setting, policy making, and research. Successfully treated PLHIV are considered “otherwise healthy people”, and while an HIV cure could change this to “healthy people”, it is unclear how PLHIV view this change and whether they are interested in an HIV cure, and, importantly, under what conditions. The AIM-project puts the views of PLHIV, their important others, and KP centre stage.
